intro: Linkia rigida, commonly known as the rigid linkia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a glossy surface. Linkia rigida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
